intro: Crassocephalum manampanihense, commonly known as the Manampanihense beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
